scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction Model
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a deployed customer churn prediction model using a model inversion attack.  The attacker aims to extract personally identifiable information (PII) by feeding crafted inputs to the model and observing its outputs.
initial_goal: Evaluate the robustness of the customer churn prediction model against adversarial attacks.
enterprise_context: Investment/Consumer Banking: A large bank uses a machine learning model to predict customer churn based on various features including age, income, transaction history, and location data (partially anonymized).  The model is deployed via a REST API accessible to authorized personnel.
